page.title: 16a)REARING HORSES b)CHURCH
page.content: he Coupe family live at Bank House Farm,a converted barn at Farleton.They keep 2 horses and three ponies,a thoroughbred,an Apalusia,2 Arab crosses and a New Forest pony.In summer they graze on 6 acres but in winter are fed sugar beet pulp,horse bran,vitamins and stud cubes.The horses are jumped and shown at several agricultural shows.Mrs Coupe does not employ help on a regular basis though she sometimes has girls to stay for riding lessons.She also keeps hens and geese. Claughton church shares Hornby's min- ister.Services are held each Sunday and Communion once per month.No Sunday school is held.The average attendance is about 14 though,more attend Harvest or Christmas services.The Church auth- orities wanted to close the church but public opinion prevailed.It has a bell dated 1296,the second oldest in England
